Job Title: Business Intelligence & Analytics Senior Product Owner

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Product Management

Description:
What You'll Do

As part of the Global Business Intelligence and Analytics team you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. This Senior Director role plays a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will lead a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future. This role reports into a member of the Enterprise Service Leadership team, specifically the BI&A Product Portfolio Leader.

This BI&A Senior Product Owner role will spearhead initiatives that redefine industry standards, cultivate a culture of continuous improvement and analytical curiosity, and leverage new technologies to solve real-world challenges. You will work as an integral part of an Agile team—working closely with the business, leadership teams, and cross-functional BI&A teams to define and evolve the vision and roadmap for global analytic products used by senior executives across BCG. You will work closely with the technical delivery teams to build solutions that meet the business needs. As well as playing a key role in change management—working with stakeholders on adoption, enablement, and on-going enhancements.

The BI&A Senior Product Owner must be a leader who is customer-centric and enjoys working with teams to design and deliver exceptional products to customers. This is a highly visible role that requires building partnership and trust among senior cross-functional stakeholders. You will also lead a team and work directly with its members to prioritize and manage what needs to be done and by when, empowering the team to deliver. You will coordinate closely with the Product Portfolio Leader to stay aligned on business priorities and make sure the team is progressing and delivering against them.

Among your responsibilities, you will: 

Set the overall product vision and strategy to direct and inform the team’s work 

Define, evolve and drive the roadmap for the global analytics and reporting platform; ensure the products deliver business results and customer value Work closely with the Product Portfolio Leader to understand and drive alignment on business strategy Ensure that products are built in an incremental way, releasing new features that create value for the business Track product performance to inform future work (define measurable KPIs to measure impact) 

Act as the key liaison on cross-functional collaboration 

Partner with leadership from functions outside of BI&A to define and build their analytic roadmap Lead cross-functional collaboration and engagement; identify highest priorities opportunities to support Support activities to define funding and resource requests that enable new analytic product builds Align cross-functional team members on best practices, knowledge sharing; foster community of excellence and innovation 

Serve as the voice of customer 

Engage in continuous discovery, proactively seek feedback from business to understand customer needs Constructively challenge business on assumptions to ensure deeper understanding of requirements, workflows and process to ensure products are fit for purpose Translate the voice and needs of customers into a prioritized list of potential innovations, engaging users as needed Leverage empirical and qualitative data to assess feature performance and inform prioritization Determine tradeoffs involving customer value, cost, and speed to execution Facilitate product demos to empower team members with real-time feedback from customers 

Oversee what is delivered by the Squad and when, ensuring to maximize business value to targeted customers 

Transform objectives into a clear vision for your team to inform the creation and prioritization of the team’s work Prioritize work through a well-organized backlog of user stories and clearly communicate what needs to be done and by when Define and clearly communicate acceptance criteria for output based on business & customer needs 

Ensure the team is supported to get work done

Act as cultural steward, foster innovation and curiosity, ensure voices are heard and team is supported to explore new ideas that can drive value Regularly engage with the Squad to offer feedback on work-in-progress and clarify requirements Engage with Chapter Leads regarding resourcing and functional expertise required in Squad Provide feedback as part of performance management of Squad members and other members of the Product Portfolio 

YOU'RE GOOD AT

Strategic product management 

Defining and articulating analytic product strategy for audiences at all levels Being customer-focused and dedicated to understanding and learning about customer needs and requirements Operating with a transparent mindset, communicating clearly and openly both above and below Being comfortable leading, directing, and empowering team members without formal management authority Driving ang managing change through ambiguous requirements and multi-disciplinary teams Influencing stakeholders up to the senior levels of the organization Bringing a data-driven approach to decision making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offs Looking for opportunities to innovate and get things done better and faster 

Business and analytic skills 

Understands the business, decision-making process, workflows, and information needs of business leaders and partners; identifies patterns and can distill insights from information to support decision making Ability to work collaboratively with teams to translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements, identifies ways to visualize and present information to support executive decisions and workflows Looks for opportunities to enhance or expand relationships with business; acts as a go-to-person for end users to interpret and use information Takes initiative and executes independently; effectively prioritizes business problems based on urgency and relevancy Interacts with Information Architects to understand how data is stored, modeled, and tagged—and can help navigate and guide technical design choices 

Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills 

Works positively and collaboratively with others and within team; builds strong and lasting relationships; can partner effectively with team members in multiple time zones Constructively challenges business on assumptions and goals; asks questions that effectively lead to deeper understanding; pushes thinking of business partners and redirects poor business assumptions Develops practical and acceptable compromises when negotiating; adapts style to changing situations and audiences with tact, poise and patience Proactively drives change with strategic persistence Leverages network effectively across functions, offices, regions and/or externally 

You Bring (experience & Qualifications)

Total 12-15+ years’ relevant experience in Business Intelligence roles (e.g. Product Owner, Project Manager) Good understanding of technology enabled business transformation, Product Strategy, Digital Transformation, Organizational Transformation Experience managing people at Sr. Manager or Executive level Understanding of agile principles and ways of working Divergent thinker who can converge ideas into tangible products Exceptional communications and stakeholder management skills Experience in consulting is a plus 

YOU'LL WORK WITH

Every member of your Product Portfolio team for which you will be its servant leader Business Leadership and internal customers, translating their voice and needs into user stories and engaging users as needed Product Portfolio Leaders, who will set the vision, roadmap, budget, and priorities & OKRs for the product team and subsequently, for the squads Scrum Masters, which will act as your right hand to remove impediments and will assess you in dealing with the different artifacts and ceremonies Other Product Owners within BCG, to share best practices and ensure alignment between squads and a culture Agile Coaches, with whom you will share passion about Agile ways of working and with whom you will shape promote business agility (within your teams and in the whole company)

Experience Level (if available): Director
